intro: Gymnandra gmelini, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Gymnandra gmelini typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are ovate and often have a hairy texture, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
